    self.do_delete_by_owner(userIds, FOLDER_LIST)

has no relationship with my codechanges.

@jonathan-hurley , I am not sure what you mean.  Ambari builds that _base URL_ value using a calculated base URL and the static string "/resources".  I think the confusion may be in the name of the variable - `jdk-location`.  I think it really should be something like `base-resources-url`.

Hey @rnettleton,

In your 2. point do you mean:
1. Removing the cyclic iterator, so **this will be possible:**
```"myservice.slave.hosts": "%HOSTGROUP::slaves_1%,%HOSTGROUP::slaves_1%"``` (assuming the slaves_1 host group has at least 2 hosts)
**but this one will not:** 
```""myservice.instances": "%HOSTGROUP::master_1%:8080,%HOSTGROUP::master_1%:8080"``` (assuming master_1 has only one host)
2. Completely removing the support for referencing the same host group multiple times.

@rnettleton, @adoroszlai  I have updated the PR with the review comments and also updated getRequiredHostgroups() - I forgot this in the original PR.

@rnettleton please let me know if removing the cyclic iterator and throwing an exception in case a host group is referenced more times in a property than the number of host in that group is the change you wanted to make.
